title: Trump Says Giuliani Will Send Report on Ukraine Trip to Attorney General
summary: 'He says he has a lot of good information,' the president said. WASHINGTON-President Trump said his personal attorney, Rudy Giuliani, is planning to send a report to the attorney general and Congress on the information he gathered on a trip this week to Ukraine.

title: Pensacola Shooting Rattles a Kingdom Struggling to Repair Its Image
summary: Saudi Arabia has been trying to improve public opinion after turbulent history with the U.S.. CAIRO-The deadly shooting by a Saudi Air Force aviation student at a U.S. military base presents the latest test for a monarchy struggling to repair its image in the West following a series of crises in recent years.

title: Bankruptcy Judge Approves Restructuring Chief for Sanchez Energy
summary: Committee representing oil firm's unsecured creditors had opposed Mohsin Meghji's appointment. A bankruptcy judge approved the appointment of turnaround veteran Mohsin Meghji as restructuring chief of Sanchez Energy Corp. , overruling junior bondholders' objections that his appointment was tainted by conflicts of interest.

title: Iran Releases U.S. Citizen in Prisoner Swap
summary: American Xiyue Wang had been jailed in country since 2016. Iran released an American citizen imprisoned in the country for more than three years on allegations of spying, in a prisoner exchange that marks a rare diplomatic opening amid growing hostility between the two countries.

title: New York Bartenders Mix Clear Drinks
summary: Resume Subscription. Some New York City bartenders are aiming to bring a little clarity to the cocktail-making process. In the most literal sense.

title: Hong Kong Airlines Finds Last-Minute Fix to Stay Afloat
summary: Carrier's struggle partly shows how city's travel industry has been hurt by protests. Hong Kong Airlines Ltd. said it had worked out a rescue plan to let it keep flying, after a near-collapse that partly reflects how the city's travel industry has been hurt by months of protests.

title: Apple's New Buds Sing an Old Tune
summary: Hot demand for new AirPods show Apple retains its hardware chops despite focus on services. Apple Inc.'s biggest product this holiday season will also likely be its smallest. It may also complicate the company's efforts to change its story.

title: Financial Abuse in the Age of Smartphones
summary: Keystroke-monitoring software, hidden cameras, GPS tracking devices: Survivors chronicle their abuse-and escape. Technology is making spousal financial abuse easier, particularly among affluent Americans.

title: Head of U.S. Business Group in Hong Kong Denied Entry to Macau
summary: The move comes amid heightened tension between the U.S. and China over trade negotiations and pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong. HONG KONG-The president of the American Chamber of Commerce in Hong Kong was denied entry on Saturday to the nearby city of Macau, which like Hong Kong is a semiautonomous region of China and normally grants Hong Kong residents rapid entry, reflecting the two cities' close business, economic and historical ties.

title: 'Boom, Boom, Boom': Migrants Sent Back to War Zone by Libyan Coast Guard
summary: Resume Subscription. OFF THE LIBYAN COAST-Adrift on an inflatable raft in the Mediterranean Sea, 45 African migrants used a satellite phone to send an SOS message, hoping for a rescue ship to take them to Italy.

title: Clients Pull Money at Hedge Fund That Helped Kill Toys 'R' Us
summary: Resume Subscription. Solus Alternative Asset Management, a New York hedge fund best known for its role in the bankruptcy of Toys "R" Us, is under pressure from investors unhappy with its performance.

title: New Jersey's Bear Hunt Continues Despite Drop in Sightings
summary: Six-day hunting period begins Monday even though sightings and complaints have fallen 70% over five years. Black bear hunting in New Jersey continues Monday despite sightings and nuisance complaints being down nearly 70% compared with five years ago.

title: The Very Brief History of Mexican Heavyweight Champs
summary: Andy Ruiz Jr., the only fighter of Mexican descent to win a heavyweight crown, defends his title on Saturday in Saudi Arabia. Mexican fans and fighters are one of the primary engines behind professional boxing in the U.S. Yet until recently, Mexican boxers had garnered over 200 world titles in every weight class except for the one that matters most-heavyweight.

title: The Drama Over 'Pageant Hopping' That Shook a Miss Universe Competition
summary: In the U.S. Virgin Islands, a beauty pageant dispute has provoked a controversy over identity and representation. After Andrea Piecuch was declared the winner of Miss Universe U.S. Virgin Islands, the local audience erupted-in protest.

title: The Best Architecture of 2019: Built to Be Experienced Off-Screen
summary: Resume Subscription. As we now enter the 10th year of Instagram, the photo-sharing network, it is not too early to wonder about its effect on architecture. An architect friend recently showed a rendering of a hotel facade to her client who cried, "That's my Instagram photo." To dazzle on a five-inch screen, a building needs only graphic pizazz. But as this year's notable buildings show, architecture involves a good deal more.

title: Black Voters Back Medicare for All, Not So Much the Candidates Pushing It
summary: Among African-Americans, Sanders and Warren trail Biden, who is pushing a more moderate expansion of health insurance. African-American voters back Medicare for All more than other groups, polls show, but the policy's two chief proponents in the 2020 Democratic presidential race haven't been able to translate that into widespread black support.

title: FedEx Taps Into Mississippi Delta to Find Workers
summary: To fill its vast workforce, delivery giant ferries 200 people four hours round trip to work the night shift at its Memphis hub. GREENWOOD, Miss.-Inside the nearly barren living room of her apartment, Mary Harris slips into a reflective yellow jacket adorned with the FedEx Corp. logo as the sun begins to set.

title: Planes, Supercomputers and Helitankers Help Fight Wildfires
summary: Resume Subscription. LOS PADRES NATIONAL FOREST, Calif.-Smoke from the Cave Fire billowed over Santa Barbara as Steve Gazdik sat in an infrared- and radar-equipped airplane flying above the 3,000-acre blaze.

title: Mexico's Polarizing President Presides Over Rising Violence, Flailing Economy
summary: President Andrés Manuel López Obrador remains popular despite cartel crime and weak growth. MEXICO CITY-On Dec. 1, tens of thousands of people gathered in Mexico City's gritty central square to celebrate Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador's first year in office. His supporters chanted "It's an honor to support Obrador."

title: The Battle of the Bulge Was Hitler's Last Gamble
summary: Seventy-five years ago this month, Germany's last-ditch offensive gave the U.S. Army its biggest test of World War II. The biggest battle fought by American forces in World War II didn't involve conquering enemy territory or liberating an occupied country. Instead, 75 years ago this month in the Battle of the Bulge, U.S. troops won a major victory simply by hanging on. If D-Day was the key offensive battle of the war in Europe, the Battle of the Bulge-known to the Germans as Operation Wacht am Rhein ("Watch on the Rhine")-was the key defensive battle. The Normandy landings tend to occupy a bigger place in our national memory, even though a defeat in either operation would have dealt a decisive blow to the Allied war effort.

title: Democrats Enter the Winnowing Phase
summary: With support still split among remaining candidates, movement of even a few voters can be significant. Running for president can be a brutal, unforgiving business, as a select group of Democrats illustrated this week by dropping out of the race.

title: Donald Marron, PaineWebber Chief and Art Collector, Dies at Age 85
summary: Mr. Marron's personal collection included works by Matisse, Picasso, Miro. Donald B. Marron, who headed the securities firm PaineWebber Group for two decades and became almost as well known for his art collection as for his Wall Street exploits, died Friday in New York. Mr. Marron, 85 years old, apparently had a heart attack while on the way to a holiday party, his family said.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Brace for the Digital-Money Wars
summary: Digitizing the Chinese yuan-and eventually the dollar-would open new fronts in the fight over privacy and trade.. THE NOT-TOO-DISTANT FUTURE-The National Security Council holds an emergency meeting. North Korea has launched a missile, capable of carrying a nuclear warhead within range of U.S. forces in Guam. At this rate, North Korea could land a nuke on the U.S. mainland in less than a year.

title: PG&E Agrees to Pay $13.5 Billion in Settlement With Victims of California Wildfires
summary: Pact removes obstacle to utility's emergence from chapter 11 bankruptcy protection. PG&E Corp. has reached a settlement with victims of the wildfires that pushed California's largest utility into bankruptcy, agreeing to pay them $13.5 billion in damages.

title: U.S. Revamps Process for H-1B Visa Application
summary: Applicants for visas for highly skilled foreign workers must register online for an initial lottery before filing their full petitions. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration announced a new process to apply for H-1B visas, requiring applicants to preregister online for an initial lottery before filing their full petitions for the coveted visas for highly skilled foreign workers.

title: Congress, White House Reach Tentative Deal Over Paid Parental Leave for Federal Workers
summary: Agreement would provide paid parental leave to 2.1 million civilian federal employees. WASHINGTON-Congress struck a tentative bipartisan agreement that would authorize 12 weeks of paid parental leave for all federal workers, in a potentially historic deal negotiated with the White House.

title: Buttigieg Releases Details About His Work at McKinsey
summary: Rival candidate Elizabeth Warren called for disclosure of his client list at the consulting firm. WATERLOO, Iowa-Democratic presidential candidate Pete Buttigieg, responding to questions about his past employment, released a detailed timeline and lengthy statement Friday evening about his nearly three years at McKinsey & Co.

title: Elon Musk Cleared by Jury in Defamation Case Over 'Pedo' Tweet
summary: Tesla CEO's lawyers argued tweet on British cave explorer was a joking taunt, not to be taken literally. A Los Angeles jury ruled in favor of Elon Musk, deciding on Friday that the Tesla Inc. chief executive's use of Twitter last year to suggest a British spelunker was a pedophile didn't amount to defamation.

title: Supreme Court Derails Plans to Resume Federal Executions
summary: Daniel Lewis Lee was set to be the first federal death-row inmate to be executed in 16 years on Monday. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court on Friday derailed Trump administration plans to resume executing federal prisoners next week, refusing to overrule lower-court orders allowing the condemned men to pursue claims that the Justice Department execution protocol violates the Federal Death Penalty Act.

title: FAA Proposes $3.9 Million Penalty Against Boeing Over Defective Parts
summary: Agency contends plane maker knowingly certified some 130 Boeing 737 jets despite installing suspect parts. Boeing Co. was hit with a proposed $3.9 million penalty by U.S. air-safety officials who said the company installed defective parts inside the wings of around 130 737 NG aircraft and then knowingly vouched they met all federal safety requirements.

title: Ericsson to Pay Over $1 Billion to Settle Bribery Case
summary: Settlement includes a $520 million criminal penalty and $540 million in illicit profits to be disgorged. WASHINGTON-Telecom-equipment maker Ericsson AB agreed to pay more than $1 billion to settle U.S. allegations that it conspired to make illegal payments to win business in five countries.

title: Trump to Hold Off Designating Mexican Cartels as Terrorist Groups
summary: On Twitter, Trump says he will take the action 'temporarily' in response to Mexican president. WASHINGTON-President Trump said he would "temporarily hold off" designating Mexican drug cartels as terrorist organizations, about a week after he said the U.S. planned to do so.

title: Pensacola Shooting Suspect Identified as Saudi Training at Air Base
summary: At least three people were killed; suspect is dead. A Saudi Air Force aviation student opened fire in a classroom at a Florida Navy base Friday, killing at least three people and injuring eight in what some lawmakers were calling terrorism.

title: Amazon, Facebook Expand in New York
summary: Tech giant agrees to take 335,000 square feet in Hudson Yards neighborhood in deal without any financial incentives from city or state. Amazon . com Inc. and Facebook Inc. are loading up on new office space in New York City, helping fuel an expansion of tech companies that is remaking a swath of Manhattan less than a year after Amazon dropped plans to build its second headquarters in the city.

title: Strong U.S. Hiring Eases Concerns About Economy
summary: Employers add 266,000 jobs, unemployment rate drops to 50-year low of 3.5%. WASHINGTON-The U.S. job market strengthened in November, as hiring jumped and unemployment returned to a half-century low, adding fuel to the economic expansion.

title: The Labor Virtues of Growth
summary: A bad jobs report for the anti-capitalists on the left and right.. Economic growth is out of political fashion these days, as intellectuals on the left and right put a higher priority on reducing inequality. Yet as Friday's blowout jobs report for November showed, the best way to lift Americans from the bottom up is a growing economy that produces a robust labor market.

title: The Backward March of Civilization
summary: A measles outbreak in Samoa kills 60 due to lack of vaccinations.. Our age likes to believe in the inevitability of human progress, but for an example of the opposite consider the Pacific island nation of Samoa. A measles outbreak there has already killed more than 60 people, and authorities declared a two-day curfew on Thursday and Friday.
